FacilityName: Fulton Market Cold Storage Company, LLC
SafetyInspectionBy: City of Chicago. Dept. of Buildings, Refrigeration
DeregistrationReasonOtherText: Under new Ownership - Site Remediated & being converted to Office/Retail

_prev_prog_3.EquipmentTested: Compressor discharge pressure and temperatures; suction pressures and temperatures; oil pressure and temperatures etc.
_prev_prog_3.Description:
Fulton Market has implemented a Process Safety Management Program under OSHA 29 CFR 1910.119.  The objective of this program is to significantly reduce the possibility of an uncontrolled release of ammonia from the ammonia refrigeration system.  The elements of this program also correspond with all standards set forth in OSHA 29 CFR 1910.111 and EPA 40 CFR 38 Subpart D, and include consistent, proactive measures toward maintaining the integrity and safe operation of the system.

All employees involved in the operation and maintenance of the refrigeration system attend initial and refresher training courses focusing on the specific safety and health hazards of anhydrous ammonia, emergency operations, and safe work practices.  

The mechanical integrity of all system components is maintained by daily inspections and regularly scheduled preventive maintenance by the facility maintenance staff.  

All employees and contractors are required to strictly adhere to standard operating procedures and safe work practices when operating or performing maintenance work on or in the vicinity of the refrigeration system.  

Automated engineering controls are incorporated into the refrigeration system, and are designed to provide early warning of incipient danger, or to actually disable the system if a hazardous or potentially hazardous condition develops.   These controls include safety cutout devices, relief valves, and ammonia detection sensors.  The detection sensors are electronically linked to an off-site, 24-hour monitoring system that immediately alerts the staff upon activation so that a decision as to the appropriate level of action or response may be immediately placed into effect.  

Fulton Market has implemented a comprehensive Management of Change procedure by which all anticipated modification to plant operations, structure and/or mechanical systems are thoroughly analyzed in regard to any potentially adverse effect they may have on safety of the facility occupants, the surrounding community, and the environment.  

As an added safety measure, virtually all refrigeration system components are located remotely and in sections of restricted access from the areas of primary activity of the facility.  This significantly reduces the possibility of inadvertent damage to the system components by forklift operations or other external causes.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
(a) The administrative, management and operations staff at Fulton Market take pride in being a part of the local community and understand that responsibility and commitment are integral components of the privilege of being a good neighbor.

To assure the preservation of this standing, the health and safety of the community, our employees and visitors, as well as the protection of the environment, are given first priority in all facets of our company operations.  

It is our policy to perform all necessary actions and maintenance on the system to prevent, as best as possible, a release from occurring.  It is also our policy to immediately report to the proper federal, state and municipal authorities any release of hazardous or extremely hazardous materials from the site so that a proper response may be mounted.  

(b) Our facility is a cold storage warehouse.  We only store edible food products and are regularly inspected by the USDA.  The stationary source is a refrigeration system.  The regulated substance is ammonia.  

(c) Fulton Market has implemented a Process Safety Management Program under OSHA 29 CFR 1910.119.  The objective of this program is to significantly reduce the possibility of an uncontrolled release of ammonia from the ammonia refrigeration system.  The elements of this program also correspond with all standards set forth in OSHA 29 CFR 1910.111 and EPA 40 CFR 38 Subpart D, and include consistent, proactive measures toward maintaining the integrity and safe operation of the system.  

(d) There have been no accidents, as defined by the regulations, within the previous five years.  

(e) We have an on-going program to perform all necessary actions and maintenance on the system to prevent, as best as possible, a release from occurring.  As part of our program we rely upon the proper federal, state and municipal authorities to assist in the response to any release of hazardous or extremely hazardous materials from the site.  

(f) The management conti

nuously reviews requests, and funds projects, to upgrade equipment as it is required to maintain a safely operating system.  

Through adherence to high safety standards, and open and ongoing dialogue with our employees and neighbors, we hope to maintain and enhance the good relationship that we?ve enjoyed for many years.
